meanings.definition: A small opening or window in a wall or screen of a church, allowing a view of the altar from a side aisle or chapel.
meanings.sent1: The hagioscope in the church wall let us see the altar clearly from the side aisle.
meanings.sent2: People in the chapel used the hagioscope to watch the ceremony at the altar.
meanings.sent3: The curious child peeked through the hagioscope and felt like a secret observer.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes, like a hagioscope, focused solely on the beauty of the altar.
meanings.sent5: The hagioscope framed the altar like a picture, drawing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To provide a hagioscope in a church for viewing the altar.
meanings.sent1: The church committee decided to hagioscope the wall for better visibility.
meanings.sent2: They hagioscoped the screen so that the altar could be seen clearly from the side.
meanings.sent3: The builders hagioscoped the wall, creating a unique way to view the altar.
meanings.sent4: She hagioscopes the church walls with precision, ensuring a perfect view of the altar.
meanings.sent5: Hagioscoping the church added a special touch, allowing everyone to see the altar.
